qas.question: How many comics did Marvel sell during 1968?
What company was distributing Marvel's titles at that point?
To whom was Marvel sold in 1968?

answers.text: the Perfect Film and Chemical Corporation

qas.question: What wholly-owned affiliate of this company did Marvel operate within?
What distributor took over Marvel's titles in 1969?
How many comic books had Goodman sold by 1968?
In what year did Independent News and Goodman first make their distribution arrangement?
What publishing businesses did Goodman sell besides Marvel Comics?
Who was the founder of the Perfect Film and Chemical Corporation?
Who did Goodman switch distribution to in 1968?

context: In <b6_0>1968<b6_0/>, while selling <a0_0><b5_0>50 million<b5_0/><a0_0/> comic books a year, company founder <b8_0>Goodman<b8_0/> revised the constraining distribution arrangement with <a1_0><b9_0>Independent News<b9_0/><a1_0/> he had reached under duress during the Atlas years, allowing him now to release as many titles as demand warranted. Late that year he sold Marvel Comics and his other publishing businesses to <a2_0>the Perfect Film and Chemical Corporation<a2_0/>, which continued to group them as the subsidiary <a3_0><b7_0>Magazine Management Company<b7_0/><a3_0/>, with Goodman remaining as publisher. In 1969, Goodman finally ended his distribution deal with Independent by signing with <a4_0>Curtis Circulation Company<a4_0/>.
